results.title: Close encounters of the sexual kind
results.brief_description: Sequel to “Contraception: ready or not” addressing myths, facts and attitudes towards sexually transmitted diseases. Designed to encourage a responsible attitude towards sex, contraception and the prevention of STD’s. The issues raised include AIDS, the need for medical check-ups, communication and condoms.
results.description: Sequel to “Contraception: ready or not” addressing myths, facts and attitudes towards sexually transmitted diseases. results.title: Close-up on Kuwait
results.creator_credit: Rodney Giesler, Derek Armstrong and Kuwait Oil Company Film Unit
results.brief_description: From Kuwait more oil is shipped annually than from any other oil port in the world, bringing in return a wealth of manufactured goods from other countries. A Government Development Board ensures that the country as a whole shares this new prosperity in the free State medical service, schools, and research into cultivation of desert areas.
results.creator_credit_for_label: Rodney Giesler, Derek Armstrong and Kuwait Oil Company Film Unit

results.title: Clive eats alligators
results.creator_credit: Jeff Spencer, David Ferris and Victoria. Schools Division. Curriculum Branch
results.brief_description:
Episode of Series “Cover to cover”.
Trevor Lunn interviews children’s writer Alison Lester about her children’s books particularly “Clive eats alligators”. She dicusses with children from South Melbourne Primary School her reasons and inspirations for writing and the choice of illustrations in her childrens’ books.

results.title: Climbing plants
results.brief_description: A study of climbing plants, including such “scramblers” as the bramble and the rose; the leaf-holding clematis, the canary creeper, the root climbing ivy, etc.

results.title: Climbing plants
results.brief_description:
Episode of Series “Botany”.
The film provides a clear explanation of every plant’s need for light and then shows the adaptations which are developed by climbing plants to fulfil this need. Time-lapse techniques are used to illustrate the twining of stems and the growth of different kinds of tendrils. Designed for class-room use.

results.title: Climb
results.creator_credit: Dewitt Jones, Churchill Films and Film Technology Company
results.brief_description: This is both a realistic adventure of rock-climbing and a metaphorical ascent in which limits are tested and personal values are explored. As the two climbers express their thoughts in the narration, we watch their breathtaking progress up a sheer rock face in Yosemite Valley. We learn a few rudiments of rock-climbing and about the climbers feelings and motivations.

results.title: Clickers club: photo adventures in curriculum
results.creator_credit: Jeff Spencer, Tony Paice and Corporate Development, Western Region and TV ED Productions
results.brief_description: Outlines the aims of a new photography club established throughout Victorian schools. Marg Sheehan interviews Leigh Hepburn who introduces the Project Kit, Roxanne Rodgers who explains its uses in an integrated curriculum and Gail Evans who applies the resources during a primary school class excursion to the zoo.

results.title: Clever Hiko Ichi
results.brief_description: Provides a backdrop for language arts activities such as storytelling, creative dramatics, and reading, by presenting an animated story about a little boy in medieval Japan who solves three difficult problems with a bit of applied science and personal fortitude.

results.title: Clearing up the weather
results.creator_credit: Box Hill College of Technical and Further Education
results.brief_description: Rob Gell, well known weather forecaster and former lecturer in Geography, discusses the weather with Peter Couchman. He describes what causes particular weather patterns, looks at various types of storm activity, and discusses “El Nino” and the “Greenhouse Effect”.
results.creator_credit_for_label: Box Hill College of Technical and Further Education
